questions.question_text:
Universal Containers (UC) has a B2C customer department that uses person accounts to track and manage all B2C customers. UC has set up a B2C site using Salesforce Experience Cloud. The VP of B2C business wants to enable self-registration on the portal so customers can create their own user accounts.

What should the Experience Cloud consultant at UC recommend so that the new users self-registering on the B2C site are captured as person accounts in Salesforce?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct.
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.emergency_response_create_person_accounts_for_self_registering_users.htm&type=5

The accurate answer is:

A. Create a custom self-registration page and Apex handler that creates a person account for each user self-registering on the portal.

Explanation:

In Salesforce Experience Cloud, the standard self-registration configuration does not natively support creating person accounts. To ensure that self-registering users are created as person accounts, a custom self-registration page with an Apex handler is necessary. This allows precise control to capture each new user as a person account, which is essential for B2C scenarios where person accounts are used.

Leaving the default Account field empty (option B) may not reliably create person accounts and could lead to issues if the configuration defaults to business accounts.
Correct Answer is B - Enable Person Accounts and leave the Default Account Field Empty

Cloud Kicks (CK) advises its diverse set of clients on how to use Experience Cloud. With new regulations taking effect, many of CK’s clients want an easy and cost effective way to set up a site and gather their customers’ communication preferences.

How should CK help compile these preferences?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
1. **Lightning Bolt Solution**: Lightning Bolt solutions provide pre-built templates and components that can be customized to meet specific business needs. By leveraging a Lightning Bolt solution, CK can quickly set up a site tailored to each client's requirements without starting from scratch.

2. **Login Flow**: A login flow can be used to gather preferences from users when they log in to the site for the first time. This allows CK to capture communication preferences as part of the registration or authentication process, ensuring that the data is collected efficiently and securely.

3. **Cost-Effectiveness**: Using a Lightning Bolt solution allows CK to leverage existing resources and templates, reducing development time and costs compared to building a custom solution from scratch.
